What are the optional arguments for the `getidentity` command in Verus, and what do they do?

The `getidentity` command in Verus has three optional arguments:

* `height`: This argument specifies the height at which to retrieve the identity information. If set to -1, it includes the mempool. If not provided, it defaults to the current height.
* `txproof`: This argument is a boolean that defaults to false. If set to true, it returns a proof of the ID.
* `txproofheight`: This argument specifies the height from which to generate the proof, and defaults to the value of `height`.

getidentity "name@ || iid" (height) (txproof) (txproofheight)

Arguments
  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) name followed by "@" or i-address of an identity
  "height"               (number, optional) default=current height, return identity as of this height, if -1 include mempool
  "txproof"              (bool, optional) default=false, if true, returns proof of ID
  "txproofheight"           (number, optional) default="height", height from which to generate a proof

Result:

Examples:
> verus getidentity "name@"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentity", "params": ["name@"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
